<$96>It sounds like you've had a very interesting adventure indeed.<New>

<$96>In order to make my new invention fly, I'm going to need some special parts.<New>

And there are the jewels that flew off of the dog statue when it exploded.<New>
If you collect those pieces for me, I'll finish my machine and send you into space.<New>
Course she may fly and again maybe not.<New>

{The Show of Life}
{The Show of Life}
by Billy Shakesbad begins…
by Billy Shakesbad begins…
Woe be woman
Woe be woman
whose fate it is to serve.
whose fate it is to serve.
May thy tongue shrivel
May thy tongue shrivel
that it spews such falsehoods.
that it spews such falsehoods.
Ah, but does not a man pull thy strings?
Ah, but does not a man pull thy strings?
We are all but puppets
We are all but puppets
of greater powers.
of greater powers.
Puppets? As in the show of life?
Puppets? As in the show of life?
Truly, birth doth
Truly, birth doth
draw wide the curtains.
draw wide the curtains.
And woman, are thy lines scripted?
And woman, are thy lines scripted?
In that I can be no one but myself,
In that I can be no one but myself,
I can say only my lines.
I can say only my lines.
So sad, to be so constrained.
So sad, to be so constrained.
It is I who feel for thee.
It is I who feel for thee.
Thine own role and fate
Thine own role and fate
has ever been written,
has ever been written,
while mine own
while mine own
changes with each breath.
changes with each breath.
Yea, tho puppet I be,
Yea, tho puppet I be,
it is hope, faith and Love
it is hope, faith and Love
that pulls my strings.
that pulls my strings.
Woman, mine ears do sting
Woman, mine ears do sting
from thy tongue.
from thy tongue.
I shall away
I shall away
in search of easier folly!
in search of easier folly!
